params.text:
Site Selection and Planting Season

The following are the important considerations when choosing squash production site and recommended planting season:

  • Select and plant squash in soil with high organic matter content and in moderately porous soil (clay loam).

  • Plant squash in October for early dry season production and from May to June for wet season production.

  • Choose an elevated or well drained area for squash production specifically during wet season. 

  • Ensure that there should be an accessible source of water for irrigation.

Land Preparation

The following are the recommended land preparation practices for squash production:

  • Properly clean the area for squash production before land preparation and planting. 

  • Plow the area two to three times. 

  • Harrow 3-4 days after plowing to pulverize the clods to fine tilt. 

  • Construct two raised beds, parallel to each other with 10 to 12 cm height at a distance of one meter. Also, construct a pair bed parallel to the two previously prepared beds at a distance of 5-10m in order to provide enough space for the plants to creep (Fig.1). 

  • Incorporate properly the organic fertilizer at a rate of 40 bags (50 kg/bag) on each side of the well prepared plot/beds.

  • Cover the plots with plastic mulch after applying organic fertilizer to control weed growth which would compete with the plant for available resources such as nutrient and moisture.

  • Pin both edges of the plastic mulch with bamboo slit for it not to be blown by strong wind. 

  • Make a round hole at about ¼ inches in diameter four inches from the plastic mulch edge and spaced one meter along the edge.
